00009 //Default constructor
00010 Delta_Functor::Delta_Functor()
00011 {
00012     totalStartTime = 0;
00013     totalEndTime = 0;
00014     totalTimeRange = 1; //We divide by this and it doesn't matter so to prevent error, set != 0
00015     startTime = 0;
00016     endTime = 0;
00017     timeRange = 1;
00018     startValue = 0;
00019     endValue = 0;
00020     valueRange = 1;
00021     exponent = 1;
00022 
00023     isCyclic = false;
00024     isBounceBack = false;
00025 }
00026 
00027 //Constructor. Pass in the start and end times for the function, as well as the beginning and ending values.
00028 //The exp value is a control over how it varies: if exp > 1, the functor starts slow and ends fast. If
00029 //0 < exp < 1, the functor starts fast and ends slow. exp = 1 is linear.
00030 Delta_Functor::Delta_Functor(int start_time, int end_time, double start_value, double end_value, double exp)
00031 {
00032     startTime = start_time;
00033     endTime = end_time;
00034     timeRange = endTime - startTime;
00035     totalStartTime = start_time;
00036     totalEndTime = end_time;
00037     totalTimeRange = endTime - startTime;
00038     startValue = start_value;
00039     endValue = end_value;
00040     valueRange = endValue - startValue;
00041     exponent = exp;
00042 //    printf("Delta Functor initialized, startTime = %i, endTime = %i, exponent = %i\n", startTime, endTime, exponent);
00043 
00044     isCyclic = false;
00045     isBounceBack = false;
00046 }
00047 
00048 //Add a functor to this one
00049 Delta_Functor Delta_Functor::addFunctor(const Delta_Functor toAdd)
00050 {
00051     if (toAdd.totalStartTime < this->totalStartTime) {
00052         this->totalStartTime = toAdd.totalStartTime;
00053     }
00054     if (toAdd.totalEndTime > this->totalEndTime) {
00055         this->totalEndTime = toAdd.totalEndTime;
00056     }
00057     this->totalTimeRange = this->totalEndTime - this->totalStartTime;
00058     if (totalTimeRange == 0) {
00059         totalTimeRange = 1; //Don't divide by zero
00060     }
00061     functors.push_back(toAdd);
00062     return * this;
00063 }
00064 
00065 Delta_Functor Delta_Functor::operator +(const Delta_Functor& toAdd) {
00066     return addFunctor(toAdd);
00067 }
00068 
00069 //Used for linked list
00070 bool Delta_Functor::operator <(const Delta_Functor& compare) {
00071     return this->totalStartTime < compare.totalStartTime;
00072 }
00073 
00074 //Used for linked list
00075 bool Delta_Functor::operator >(const Delta_Functor& compare) {
00076     return this->totalStartTime > compare.totalStartTime;
00077 }

00099 //Set one functor equal to another
00100 Delta_Functor Delta_Functor::operator =(const Delta_Functor toEqual)
00101 {
00102     startTime = toEqual.startTime;
00103     endTime = toEqual.endTime;
00104     timeRange = toEqual.timeRange;
00105     totalStartTime = toEqual.totalStartTime;
00106     totalEndTime = toEqual.totalEndTime;
00107     totalTimeRange = toEqual.totalTimeRange;
00108     startValue = toEqual.startValue;
00109     endValue = toEqual.endValue;
00110     valueRange = toEqual.valueRange;
00111     exponent = toEqual.exponent;
00112     functors = toEqual.functors;
00113     return *this;

00116 //Reset this functor so that starts over from the current time
00117 void Delta_Functor::reset()
00118 {
00119     startTime = SDLLoader::getTime();
00120     endTime = startTime + timeRange;
00121 
00122     isCyclic = false;
00123     isBounceBack = false;
00124 }

00150 //Shift the beginning and end times for the functor and all children
00151 void Delta_Functor::shiftTime(int toShift) {
00152 
00153     startTime += toShift;
00154     endTime += toShift;
00155 
00156     totalStartTime += toShift;
00157     totalEndTime += toShift;
00158 
00159     for(std::list<Delta_Functor>::iterator i = functors.begin(); i != functors.end(); i++) {
00160         i->shiftTime(toShift);
00161     }
00162 }

00178 //Concatenate two functors
00179 Delta_Functor Delta_Functor::cat(Delta_Functor toCat)
00180 {
00181     //Move the time so that toCat's time begins when this functor ends
00182     toCat.shiftTime( -(toCat.totalStartTime - totalEndTime) );
00183 
00184     *this = *this + toCat;
00185     return * this;
00186 }
00187

00189 void Delta_Functor::reverse() {

00194     Delta_Functor thisCopy(startTime, endTime, startValue, endValue, exponent);
00195     cat(thisCopy);
00196 
00197     //Create a new, empty functor
00198     Delta_Functor toReturn;
00199 
00200     /* This doesn't work! THIS IS PAIN */
00201     //Reverse the startValue and endValue for all functors in the functors list, then add them to toReturn
00202     for (std::list<Delta_Functor>::iterator i = functors.begin(); i != functors.end(); i++) {
00203         int tmp = i->startValue;
00204         i->startValue = i->endValue;
00205         i->endValue = tmp;
00206         i->exponent = 1.0/i->exponent;
00207         toReturn.cat(*i);
00208     }
00209 
00210     
00211 
00212     *this = toReturn;

00215 //Return false if not complete or return true
00216 bool Delta_Functor::isComplete() {
00217     int currentTime = SDLLoader::getTime();
00218     if (totalEndTime <= currentTime) {
00219         return true;
00220     }
00221     return false;
00222 }
00223 
00224 //Returns the current value of the functor, based on the current time
00225 double Delta_Functor::getValue()
00226 {
00227     int currentTime = SDLLoader::getTime();
00228     double toReturn = 0;
00229     if (startTime <= currentTime && endTime >= currentTime)
00230     {
00231         toReturn += pow((double)(currentTime - startTime)/(double)timeRange, exponent)*valueRange + startValue;
00232     }
00233     else if (isCyclic && startTime <= currentTime) //Interesting fact - we only want to perform the cyclic behaviour IF the functor has started. I think that this makes a lot of sense. If you want it to go always, simply start your functor at 0.
00234     {
00235         int cycleTime = (currentTime - startTime /*interval*/) % (int)timeRange + startTime;
00236         toReturn += pow((double)(cycleTime - startTime)/(double)timeRange, exponent)*valueRange + startValue;
00237     }
00238     else
00239     {
00240         toReturn = 0;
00241     }
00242 
00243     //Add on any other functors that are contained within this one
00244     for (std::list<Delta_Functor>::iterator i = functors.begin(); i != functors.end(); i++)
00245     {
00246         toReturn += i->getValue();
00247     }
00248     return toReturn;
00249 }
